results.title: Herding cattle on the Niger
results.creator_credit: Hermann Schlenker and International Film Foundation
results.brief_description:
Episode number 5 of Series “African village life”.
Illustrates how the West African Peul (or Fulani) tribesmen tend their cattle, wandering from one grazing land to another. Shows them driving their herd across the Niger River. No spoken word. Suitable for upper primary, lower and middle secondary levels.

results.title: Anansi the spider: a tale from the Ashanti
results.creator_credit: Gerald McDermott and Gerald McDermott Films
results.brief_description:
Episode number 1 of Series “African folklore”.
Anansi is a folk hero of the Ashanti people of Ghana and is a spider with human qualities. In this tale he falls into a river and is swallowed by a fish. After his rescue another accident befalls him. Rescued again, Anansi wishes to reward his son who has helped him with the aid of a beautiful white globe. Nyame, the One god, resolves the dilemma for him by setting the globe in the sky: it is the moon. Animation by Vincent Bell and narrated by Athmani Magoma. Animation inspired by the sophisticated geometric forms of the Ashanti.

results.title: The Magic tree
results.creator_credit: Gerald McDermott and Landmark Educational Media
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “African folklore”.
A haunting tale from the Congo about Movgumgu, a homely, unloved boy who leaves his family for a lonely river voyage. Relates his experiences with a Magic Tree which he finds in a river clearing.

results.title: Southern region
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “African Continent”.
Surveys southern Africa as a region of great wealth and potential. Gold and diamond fields; sheep ranches of the western uplands, and warm fruit lands of the eastern coast. Shows the people that immigration and migration have brought together - Bantu, Dutch, English and Asians; challenges in developing the region’s resources and in solving problems of emerging nationhood.

results.title: Tropical region
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “African Continent”
Shows geographic regions; population distribution, cultural influences, primary agricultural and natural resources, and emergence and development of the tropical region of Africa. Show four major regions: coastal lowlands, Congo Basin, Eastern Highlands, and Sudan, their climates, products and habitants, and the water power and mineral resources available but undeveloped.

results.title: Northern region
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “African Continent”.
The interaction of the modern with the colourful and traditional characterises Northern Africa. This geographic region is greatly influenced by three factors: its primarily Arab background and culture, its age-old lack of water, and its long history of European influence. Shows oasis farming, craftsmanship, and modern industries and cities; and views some of the problems that face Moslems and Europeans.

results.title: Serving suggestion
results.creator_credit: AFTRS, Kate Riedl and Tony Thorne
results.brief_description: A snot nosed kid called Kevin eats his way through the snack aisle in the supermarket. When Kevin decides to go for the ‘Chocky Pops’, he doesn’t realise that he’ll end up with more than a mouthful. The supermarket becomes a jungle in this impressive computer animated short.

results.title: The Journey
results.brief_description: An old man sits in a rowboat on an endless gravel ocean remembering episodes from his youth and middle age. The three vignettes presented in this film using model animation come to represent the old man’s search for spiritual meaning and purpose in his life. The tightrope becomes a metaphor for his precarious passage from boyhood to adulthood, while the door and ladder sequence comes to represent the man’s desire for meaning through material wealth. The final rowboat episode thus becomes the pinnacle of the man’s quest - a final search for fulfilment that will take him beyond life.
